Text.val: Author: Stephan Huppertz
Created: 07.06.2013 (SCR15857) (based on old copy of BSP099)
11.07.2014 SH SCR18764 Empty files will be skipped now (remain in the scanned directory)
08.07.2014 SH SCR19009 Added client stock file handling (directory type = 39)
-- General initializations
... retrieve email addresses of operators, used to send them emails in
case of errors when files are copied/deleted (move files), Job is not going to MSGW
... Set triggers which directries have to be scanned and also the sequence of scans
.... determine all directories
-- Scan directories in specified sequence (max 6 directories)
... unknow directory (3)
... new invoice directory (4)
... all invoice directory (5)
... debtor file directory (35)
... dunning histroy file directory (37)
... stock file directory (39)
-- Check for existing files in directory (2) = handling, if exists they have to
be moved to directory (3) = unknow (could happen if BSP099 crashed in a previous run))
-- Operators get an email, if one of the file move (copy/delete) operations failed or in case of non existing directories
.. in case of directory does not exists no MSGW, email will be sent to operators in parent task
-- Cleanup temp table TEMP_BSP099
-- Get files from directory
... store filename to memory table for further handling
-- Empty files cannot be handled in further processes, they will remain in the directory without any email notification
-- Check if file is modifiable, if not then the file will not be handled (move file is not possible, especially
the delete operation), will remain in the directory without any email notification

ExpSyntax.val: Trim (Str ({0,3},'9'))&' new client files will be handled now within directory '&Trim({0,1})

Text.val: ... sorted by file modified date/time (first in, first handle)
-- In case of directory 3 (unknown) file handling, the modification date/time of the file should be older than the
current date/time stamp - GSET_TIME (275), else the file will be handled later (next BSP099 run)
-- Add date/time stamp to filename and move file to handling directory
-- Make sure that files to be handled are UTF-8 encoded
(In case of errors within this handler, job turns to MSGW --> Problem with Java or not properly defined encoding settings)
-- Start BSP200
... first split client file via BSP104
... skip BSP104 in case of ODC200 debtor file format
-- Start BSP200 only if invoice file is
... not corrupted (incomplete) detected in BSP104
... not spittted in BSP104
... not moved from \unknown directory to \debtor or \new or \all directories within BSP104
... write info to job log regarding the client file which will be handled
... in case of RO client files admin number = 11 has to be used in BSP200
... write info to job log regarding the debtor file which will be handled
-- Replace blanks by '_' in file name regarding Unix rules (OSH commands does
not work properly
... and finally delete the source file if copy was successfull
... Operators gets an email, if one of the previous I/O operations failed (no MSGW)
... delete file from handling directory (aasume copied file is incomplete)
... sorted by file modified date/time (first in, first handle)
NOTE: Only one file is handled (see end task condition)
NOTE: The handling of directory 37 files (Dunning history file) is different than the other standard file handling because of
historical reasons (initially implemented at 04.12.2009 by AK, see SCR15121)
... continue only if no BDC229 job is currently active
delete source file after copy
Submit BDC229

ExpSyntax.val: ' one new incoming DNH (Duning history) file will be handled now'

Text.val: -- Get files from directory (2) = handling
-- In case of existing files, they have to be moved to directory (3) = unknown
... copy failed
... delete operation of copied file in directory (2) = handling failed
... undo the copy
